description: A list of additional courtrooms set up to support the justice system.

details.body:
We used additional temporary courts (known as ‘Nightingale’ courts) as one of a range of measures to increase capacity and alleviate the pressure on courts and tribunals during the pandemic.

Since then, we have kept many of these sites open where there is an operational need and benefit to doing so. Additional venues are set up on a temporary basis where there is a local need for extra court capacity and the venue is available.

This page shows the sites currently in use by region and will be updated as new sites open and others close.

Check the status and contact details for a court or tribunal

London

Court Type of work Temporary court Other venue Number of courtrooms

Croydon Crown Court Crime including jury trials Leonardo Hotel – formerly Jurys Inn, Wellesley Road, Croydon CR0 9XY   2
Inner London Crown Court Crime including jury trials   Royal Courts of Justice, The Strand, London WC2A 2LL 2
Wood Green Crown Court Crime including jury trials   The Court House, The Hyde, Hendon NW9 7BY 4

Midlands

Court Type of work Temporary court Other venue Number of courtrooms
Telford Justice Centre Civil and family Telford Annex, Telford Square, Malinsgate, Telford, Shropshire TF3 4JP   3

North West

Court Type of work Temporary court Other venue Number of courtrooms
Blackpool Magistrates’ Court Civil Former Fleetwood Magistrates’ Court, The Esplanade, Fleetwood, FY7 6AT   4

South East

Court Type of work Nightingale court Other venue Number of courtrooms

South West

Court Type of work Temporary court Other venue Number of courtrooms
Gloucester Crown Court Crime including jury trials Former Cirencester Magistrates’ Court, The Forum, Cirencester, Gloucestershire GL7 2PG   2
Southampton Combined Court Tribunals   The Courts of Justice, London Road, Southampton SO15 2XQ 2

Wales

Court Type of work Temporary court Other venue Number of courtrooms
